code:
def manage_playlist(playlist):
    """
    This function takes a playlist dictionary where the key is the song name
    and the value is the artist. It will remove the last added song and return
    the updated playlist.
    """
    # Remove the last added song from the playlist
    try:
        playlist.popitem()
    except KeyError:
        print("The playlist is already empty!")

    return playlist

# Initialize a playlist dictionary
my_playlist = {
    "Shape of You": "Ed Sheeran",
    "Blinding Lights": "The Weeknd",
    "Levitating": "Dua Lipa",
    "Watermelon Sugar": "Harry Styles"
}

# Manage the playlist by removing the last added song
updated_playlist = manage_playlist(my_playlist)
print("Updated Playlist:", updated_playlist)

# Intentionally creating an error: using pop instead of popitem
# This will cause a TypeError because pop expects at least one argument
my_playlist.pop()
